# $\first{Super Basic}$

***

### $\second{Comments}$

```{r}
# This is a comment, it won't do anything
```

*** 

### $\second{Help}$

Use a `?` to pull up information on a package and its arguments
```{r eval=FALSE}
?round
```

***

### $\second{Data Types}$

|**Type** |**Definition**        |**Example**|
|:--------|:---------------------|:----------|
|Integer  |number with no decimal|`100L`     |
|Double   |number with decimal   |`100.0`    |
|Character|value-less characters |`"100"`    |
|Logical  |binary value          |`TRUE`     |

`typeof()` checks the type 

`as.*()` converts 

* `as.integer()`
* `as.double()`
* `as.character()`
* `as.logical()`

<br>

Using a double in an operation will return a double 

```{r}
typeof(1.0 + 1L)
```

<br> 

Using just integers will result in integers unless it is division

```{r}
typeof(1L + 1L)
typeof(1L / 1L)
```

***

### $\second{Boolean Operators}$

|**Function**            |**Symbol**|
|:-----------------------|:---------|
|Equal                   |`==`      |
|Not Equal               |`!=`      |
|Greater Than            |`>`       |
|Greater Than or Equal to|`>=`      |
|Less Than               |`<`       |
|Less Than or Equal to   |`<=`      |
|And                     |`&`       |
|Or                      |`|`       |

***

### $\second{Variables}$

`<-` sets a variable equal to whatever you want

```{r}
variable <- "whatever you want"
```

<br> 

Setting a variable to a variable copies the value; it is NOT a link

```{r}
a <- 1
b <- a

a <- 'see!'

print(str_c("a = ", a, "; b = ", b))
```
***

### $\second{Factors}$

Factors turn ordinary strings into categorical variables

```{r}
example_strings <- c("medium", "slow", "slow", "medium", "fast")

example_strings
```

```{r}
example_factor <- factor(example_strings)

example_factor
```

```{r}
example_ordered_factor <- factor(example_strings, 
                                 ordered = TRUE, 
                                 levels = c("slow","medium","fast"))

example_ordered_factor
```

# $\first{Vectors}$

(One dimensional array; all the same data type)

***

### $\second{Creating}$

#### $\third{- Basic Vector}$

```{r}
eg_vector <- c(1, 2, 3)
eg_vector
```

<br>

#### $\third{- Named Vector}$

```{r}
names(eg_vector) <- c("item1", "item2", "item3")
eg_vector
```

***

### $\second{Operations}$

#### $\third{- Adding Vectors}$

**Within**

```{r}
sum(eg_vector)
```

**Between** 

`c(1, 2, 3) + c(4, 5, 6)` = 

`c((1 + 4), (2 + 5), (3 + 6))`  =

`c(5, 7, 9)`  

```{r}
A_vector <- c(1, 2, 3)
B_vector <- c(4, 5, 6)
A_vector + B_vector
```

<br>

#### $\third{- Evaluating}$

**Testing**

```{r}
A_vector > 2
```

**Extracting**

```{r}
A_vector[A_vector > 2]
```

***

### $\second{Indexing}$

#### $\third{- Extract a specific item}$

```{r}
eg_vector[1]
```

<br>

#### $\third{- Extract a set of specific items}$

```{r}
eg_vector[c(1,3)]
```

<br>

#### $\third{- Extract a range of items}$

```{r}
eg_vector[1:3]
```

<br>

#### $\third{- Extract a specific named item}$

```{r}
eg_vector["item1"]
```

***

### $\second{Editing}$

```{r}

eg_vector
```

# $\first{Dataframes}$

(Two dimensional array; all the same data type within a column, but different columns can have different data types)

***

### $\second{Creating}$

```{r}
name <- c("Mercury", "Venus", "Earth", "Mars")
type <- c("Terrestrial", "Terrestrial", "Terrestrial", "Terrestrial")
diameter <- c(0.382, 0.949, 1, 0.532)
rotation <- c(58.64, -243.02, 1, 1.03)
rings <- c(FALSE, FALSE, FALSE, FALSE)

planets_df <- data.frame(name, type, diameter, rotation, rings)

planets_df
```

***

### $\second{Operations}$

#### $\third{- Order Ascending}$

```{r}
planets_df[order(planets_df$diameter),"name"]
```

<br>

#### $\third{- Order Descending}$

```{r}
planets_df[order(planets_df$diameter,decreasing=TRUE),"name"]
```

***

### $\second{Indexing}$

#### $\third{- Extract a specific item}$

```{r}
planets_df[2,1]
```

<br>

#### $\third{- Extract a subset}$

```{r}
planets_df[2:3,1:2]
```

<br>

#### $\third{- Extract a specific subset}$

```{r}
planets_df[c(1,3),1:2]
```

<br>

#### $\third{- Extract all rows of a column}$

```{r}
planets_df[,1]
```

<br>

#### $\third{- Extract all columns of a row}$

```{r}
planets_df[1,]
```

<br>

#### $\third{- Extract column by name}$

```{r}
planets_df[,"diameter"]
```

```{r}
planets_df$rings
```

<br>

#### $\third{- Extract based on values}$

```{r}
planets_df[planets_df$rotation<0,]
```

# $\first{Loops}$

***

### $\second{While}$

#### $\third{- External Condition}$

```{r eval=FALSE}
while (condition) {
  expression
}
```

<br>

#### $\third{- Indexed}$

```{r eval}
i <- 1

while (i <= 3) {
  print(i)
  
  i <- i + 1
}
```

***

### $\second{For}$

#### $\third{- Iterate Over a List}$

```{r}
fruit_list <- c("Apples", "Strawberries", "Bananas")

for (item in fruit_list) {
  print(str_c("I love ",item))
}
```

<br>

#### $\third{- Iterate Over a Sequence}$

```{r}
for (i in seq_along(1:3)) {
  print(i + 1)
}
```

<br>

#### $\third{- Fill in a New List}$

```{r}
dummy_list <- list()

for (i in seq_along(1:3)) {
  dummy_list[[i]] <- i + 1
}

dummy_list
```

# $\first{Functions}$

***

### $\second{Existing}$

* `install.packages("package")` to install package once 
* `library(package)` to load package each script 
* `update.packages("package")` to update package as needed

***

### $\second{Creating}$

#### $\third{- Basic}$

```{r eval=FALSE}
function_name <- function (argument_1, argument_2) {
  expression
}
```

<br>

#### $\third{- Default Values}$

This allows for the user to add an argument, but if not, the default is used. 

```{r eval=FALSE}
function_name <- function (argument_1, argument_2 = default_value) {
  expression
}
```

<br>

#### $\third{- Infinite Variables}$

```{r eval=FALSE}
function_name <- function(...) {
  expression using ...
}
```

<br>

#### $\third{- Error Messages}$

```{r eval=FALSE}
function_name <- function(argument) {
  if (condition) {
    stop("Error message", call. = FALSE)
  }
  expression 
}
```

***

### $\second{Applying}$

* `lapply` returns a list
* `sapply` tries to return a simplified list as a vector or matrix
* `vapply` is like `sapply` but with the result type specified using `data type(length)`

```{r}
lapply(c(1, 2, 3), sqrt)
sapply(c(1, 2, 3), sqrt)
vapply(c(1, 2, 3), sqrt, numeric(1))
```

<br>

#### $\third{- Additional Arguments}$

`lapply(vector, function, other_arguments)` is how you add additional arguments

```{r}
lapply(c(1, 2, 3), log, base = 2)
```

<br>

#### $\third{- On the Fly Functions}$

`lapply(vector, function(argument){new_function expression})` is how you apply a new function

```{r eval=FALSE}
lapply(c(1, 2, 3), function(x, y){x/(x^y)}, 2)
```

# $\first{Regular Expressions}$

****

### $\second{Basics}$

![](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/social-lorax/howto_codebooks/master/images/regex.png)

****

### $\second{Testing}$

[**regexr**](https://regexr.com/)

![](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/social-lorax/howto_codebooks/master/images/regex_test.jpg)

***

### $\second{Apply}$

#### $\third{- Search}$

* `grepl()` returns TRUE when a pattern is found in the corresponding character string.
* `grep()` returns a vector of indices of the character strings that contains the pattern.

```{r}
eg_text <- c("123 Main Street, Anytown, Any State, 12345, United States",
             "This is not an address",
             "567 Country Road, Notown, Any State, 54321, United States")

grepl("[0-9]+ [a-zA-Z]+ [a-zA-Z]+, [a-zA-Z]+, [a-zA-Z]+ [a-zA-Z]+, [0-9]+, United States", eg_text)

grep("[0-9]+ [a-zA-Z]+ [a-zA-Z]+, [a-zA-Z]+, [a-zA-Z]+ [a-zA-Z]+, [0-9]+, United States", eg_text)
```

<br>

#### $\third{- Replace}$

* `sub()` replaces the first match
* `gsub()` replaces all matches

```{r}
eg_text <- "This 123 has 456 random 789 numbers"

sub("[0-9]+", "", eg_text)

gsub("[0-9]+", "", eg_text)
```
